cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 555 miles E of the north-western Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to slow, turn northwest today, then track west-southwest across the north-western Bahamas and toward the east coast of Florida, eventually curving inland over the peninsula and into the south-eastern United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central to south-east Florida coast (likely somewhere between Palm Beach and Cape Canaveral)

weather_observation.watch_coast: A Tropical Storm Watch is currently only in effect for the north-western Bahamas; none posted yet for Florida
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-western Bahamas, the entire east coast of Florida, and eventually portions of Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (2–4 ft surge possible along Biscayne Bay and adjacent Atlantic beaches)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm force winds are possible at the port late Wednesday night into Thursday with a 20 % cumulative chance of ≥34 kt and a 4 % chance of ≥50 kt.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Increasing onshore flow may push water levels 2–4 ft above normal tides in vulnerable low-lying areas of Miami-Dade if the storm makes landfall north of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could bring 2–4 inches with isolated higher totals that may cause localized flooding of low-lying areas and terminal approaches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents beginning mid-week; possible operational disruptions to container cranes and cruise terminals due to gusty squalls.
